headline.print_headline: A Hospital of the Many Will Treat Far Fewer
headline.main: Beth Israel, a Hospital That Once Took Everyone, Will Take Far Fewer

snippet: Employees and community members worried how the downsizing of the Manhattan hospital, which was founded by immigrants, for immigrants, would affect their lives.
abstract: Mount Sinai officials say Beth Israel Hospital will reduce its bed capacity to 70 from 825 following move, but confirms that 153 existing beds for mental health patients will remain; reduction follows long, rich history in which hospital served and was developed by diverse immigrant groups; move has upset residents and employees.
